Instruction: Slowly incorporate the flour mixture into the beaten eggs, mixing until fully combined.

In a large skillet or frying pan, heat oil over medium heat until hot. Pour in batter to form pancakes of your desired size, and cook until golden brown on one side, about 1 to 2 minutes. Flip pancakes and cook until the other side is golden brown, about another 1 to 2 minutes.
In a large bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Add eggs, milk, and melted butter; mix until smooth.
Remove the muffin tin from the oven and carefully pour batter evenly into each cup, filling them about two-thirds full.
Bake in the preheated oven until puffed and golden brown, about 25 minutes.
Once baked, remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly before serving.

Yorkshire puddings should be taken out of the cases right away to avoid sticking. If they are kept warm, they may collapse. Therefore, the dinner should be timed to finish as the Yorkshire puddings are ready.
